nodes.bodyText: We can use format here to interpolate warehouseDirectory.
I think this is fine. Single concatenation is more readable than format imo.
Is there any case where it's okay to return invalid URI? Isn't it better to reporting an exception properly instead of just returning the original table location?

+1.
Can you provide explanation in the comment when do we expect the exception to happen.
I did not mean to do that, I don't know how that slipped through.

I guess this relates to trinodb/tempto@706f495
There, it was done defensively, as location can be specified as "path", not uri. Wasn't sure if metastore will always normalize it, by adding hdfs://host/ prefix.
Maybe it does.
Even if it doesn't, new URL("/user/hive/warehouse/foo").getPath() works just like new URL("hdfs://hadoop-master:9000/user/hive/warehouse/foo").getPath().

This property is weridly named. Based on usege it means "Hive is creating tables as ACID by default". Hence the name suggest "Tempto should create tables as ACID".
We should either flip the meaning.
Or name it sth like "orc_tables_created_as_acid_in_hive".
But I think we should just reveverse its meaning to "Tempto should create tables as non-transactional".
And then use:
(createTablesAsAcid.orElse(false) ? "TBLPROPERTIES ('transactional' = 'true')" : "");

makes sense?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,6 +21,7 @@ databases:
     warehouse_directory_path: /user/hive/warehouse
     inject_stats_for_immutable_tables: true
     inject_stats_for_mutable_tables: true
+    create_tables_as_acid: false

nodes.bodyText: This should possibly be consumed by table fulfillers which are part of Tempto itself. Not only by the code here. But it can be a follwoup.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,6 +21,7 @@ databases:
     warehouse_directory_path: /user/hive/warehouse
     inject_stats_for_immutable_tables: true
     inject_stats_for_mutable_tables: true
+    enforce_non_transactional_tables: false
